bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, December 5, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison requests another copy of Moran's autographed photograph to send to Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, December 5, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 5, 1940

div1.p:
It is fine to have your letter and to know that
you had such a delightful time here. I certainly hope
that I may some day come to Havana and enjoy the
hospitality which you so generously offer. Please give
our regards to Mrs. Moran whose coming we appreciated
greatly.

We have a special favor to ask of you. Doctor
Hench sent us, before the exercises, the picture of
yourself which you had given to him especially autographed
for him. Somewhere that picture has been lost, either
in the mail or elsewhere. He is very much concerned
about it. Would you be kind enough to get from your
photographer another copy of your best portrait, auto-
graph it again to Doctor Hench and send it to us to be
forwarded to him. Please send it Air Mail and enclose
in your letter a note of the entire cost.

Do not attempt to pay this expense yourself be-
cause we must insist upon doing it. You have done a
great deal for us and we want to pay this.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Cooper Hutchison Mr. John J. Moran
